title: League won't open solution for Mac
body:
I was having a ton of trouble getting League to open on my 2012 macbook pro, i tried everything i could find on the internet, but no matter what i did it would not open, it would say it stopped responding etc... then i realized i downloaded it from google chrome and maybe that had something to do with it, seeing as i can't play Netflix on chrome i was thinking it was a chrome issue, then i realized the game probably tries to launch through Safari because that's Mac default web browser, but i downloaded it from chrome so the format might be incomprehensible to safari, so i deleted all the LOL data on my comp and i downloaded it from Safari, it completely downloaded in about 2 hours and im on my like 12th match in the game no lag nothing, it works great so make sure you guys download it from Safari if you have a Mac, the LOL Logo is different through Safari, everything about the download was different. if your having the same problem as me download from Safari only for Macs and you will see what im saying.
 good luck Summoner! -Exhalo

replies.body: League doesn't run through a browser, it will run through it's own app that you can [download here.](https://signup.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/signup/redownload)  The client not launching like this is usually caused by a connection issue that can't reach the patching service and launch.  I recommend going over the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to help troubleshoot this, it may also help with the issue using other sites on your browser though no guarantee.  I hope that helps!
